author: Special Correspondent
text:
Former Union Health Minister and PMK chief ministerial candidate, Anbumani Ramadoss, on Friday said the DMDK’s announcement of going it alone in the Assembly elections looked more like posturing than a committed stand.

“DMDK leader Vijayakant suddenly comes on stage and says no negotiations took place with anyone. If so, why did he wait so long to announce? He could have said this long ago,” Mr. Anbumani charged and added that even during the run up to the Lok Sabha elections, Mr. Vijayakant held a rally and said the cadres wanted him to go alone. “But he eventually joined the NDA,” he added.

The Dharmapuri MP said the DMDK stating that it was the true alternative to the two Dravidian parties was amusing. “What is the record of Mr. Vijayakant as Leader of the Opposition? He did not even have the courage to attend the proceedings. What would such a person do if he becomes the Chief Minister?” he stated.

Mr. Anbumani said unlike Mr. Vijayakant, he had proven track record as the Union Health Minister. “The PMK is the only party that has been consistent with its announcement that we will not align with the Dravidian parties anymore,” he claimed.
title: ‘Vijayakant posturing’
